p: Average mortality rates of eggs varied significantly across treatments, being lowest under control conditions (14.2 ± 1.9%) followed by the heat (28.8 ± 1.9%) and finally the desiccation treatment (38.8 ± 1.9%; control < heat < desiccation, Tukey's HSD; Table 2a, Figure 3a). Overall, species did not differ significantly in mortality rates ( L. dispar: 23.4 ± 1.4%; L. tityrus: 29.0 ± 1.9%; L. helle: 30.7 ± 2.0%). However, species differed in their responses to different levels of stress in egg mortality (significant species by treatment interaction). Egg mortality rate increased most strongly between control and heat/desiccation stress in L. helle (by 25.0 and 31.0 percentage points for the heat and desiccation treatment, respectively), but weaker in L. dispar (11.6 and 25.9 percentage points) and especially in L. tityrus (7.8 and 15.6 percentage points). Mortality rates differed significantly among populations and groups.
